stance_1: I do not enjoy eating breakfast as much as I did as a kid
stance_2: I eat less pork than I did growing up
justification: The interviewee states that eating less pork is linked to enjoying breakfast less, as pork was mostly consumed as breakfast meat.

stance_1: I eat meat at least once a day
justification: Enjoyment of eating meat implicitly supports the routine of eating meat at least once daily.

stance_1: I eat meat at least once a day
stance_2: Meat is a good source of protein for me
justification: The interviewee cites meat as a good source of protein as a reason for including it regularly in their diet.

stance_2: Meat is a good source of protein for me
justification: The interviewee gives both enjoyment and protein content as reasons for eating meat.

stance_1: I eat meat at least once a day
stance_2: My friends eat a lot of meat
justification: Similar routines among social circles can reinforce frequent meat consumption.

stance_1: I eat meat at least once a day
stance_2: My parents do not eat red meat
justification: Parents' avoidance of red meat contrasts with the interviewee's frequent meat consumption, highlighting a difference in dietary habits, though not direct conflict.
